threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

attributes.magic: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, Intel 80386, version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, stripped

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET SCAN Potential SSH Scan OUTBOUND
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET 22 (msg:"ET SCAN Potential SSH Scan OUTBOUND"; flow:to_server; flags:S,12; threshold: type threshold, track by_src, count 5, seconds 120; reference:url,en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brute_force_attack; classtype:attempted-recon; sid:2003068; rev:7; metadata:created_at 2010_07_30, confidence Medium, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2019_07_26;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Observed DNS Query to .cfd TLD
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET INFO Observed DNS Query to .cfd TLD"; dns.query; dotprefix; content:".cfd"; nocase; endswith; fast_pattern; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2065867; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, tls_state plaintext, created_at 2025_11_20, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, tag Description_Generated_By_Proofpoint_Nexus, updated_at 2025_11_20; target:src_ip;)

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: The sample is a Linux botnet agent, specifically a variant from the Mirai or Gafgyt (Bashlite) families, targeting embedded and IoT devices. It demonstrates several core malicious behaviors: 1) A 'killer' module (sub_804bef0 and sub_804c060) that monitors /proc/ to terminate competing processes based on path and memory maps; 2) Anti-analysis techniques using ptrace (PTRACE_TRACEME) to detect debugging; 3) Network reconnaissance via SSDP M-SEARCH discovery strings used for UPnP/gateway exploitation; 4) Hardcoded targeting of embedded device paths (e.g., /root/dvr_app, /anko-app, and Netis routers). The binary contains aggressive strings typical of botnet authors ('Self Rep Fucking NeTiS...') and implements multiple network attack vectors consistent with DDoS functionality.
